hi: is there a mp3 to wma converter for ubuntu?
ffmpeg ought to be able to do it
its a command line too --  ffmpeg -i file.mp3 file.wma
you need to setup networking for the vmware guest - http://www.vmware.com/support/ws3/doc/ws32_network8.html
that is the way to restart networking.

have you checked the vmware guest configuration -- you have to ensure that guest has the capability to get on the phycial network. something like this here. http://www.vmware.com/support/ws3/doc/ws32_network8.html
make sure all processes that have files/directories open on that device are properly terminated first
but you can't really dismount a device until all processes that are using files on it have been closed.
to find out what process might have files open.  sudo lsof | grep -i $DEVICE_NAME
it's ok to dismount it if it is done properly
don't dismount it if files are still being accessed on it
how are you launching gparted there?
